definition[0]: a person, group etc that gives something, especially money, to help an organization or country
example[0]: We urgently need more assistance from donor countries  (=countries that give money, food etc to help in poor countries or disaster areas).
example[1]: An anonymous donor  (=whose name is unknown) has given £500 towards the restoration fund.
definition[1]: someone who gives blood or a body organ so that it can be used in the medical treatment of someone else
example[2]: Some patients die before a suitable donor is found.
heading[0]: – Meaning 2: someone who gives blood or a body organ so that it can be used in the medical treatment of someone else
example[4]: After a 10-month wait, a suitable donor was found.
example[5]: Are you willing to register as a blood donor?
example[6]: There are not nearly enough organ donors.
example[7]: There is a shortage of kidney donors.
example[8]: Her husband was infertile so they conceived using a sperm donor.
example[9]: She had to wait for over a year before a donor organ became available.
example[10]: The technique keeps the donor heart beating while it is transported.
example[11]: Donor blood had to be used during the operation.
example[12]: Do you carry a donor card?
definition[2]: someone who gives money or other valuable things to people who are ill, hungry, poor etc
example[13]: His fines were paid by an anonymous donor.
example[14]: Japan is Asia’s biggest foreign aid donor, giving over $1.1 billion in official development assistance and loans.
